settings.heading: SIZE CONVERSION
settings.content: If you have a hat that fits you well, check the sizing on the tag. Then, using our size conversion chart below, simply convert this size to a measurement on the table. This will help you determine the perfect size of your new Lack of Color Hat.

settings.heading: How to measure
settings.content:
Each Lack of Color piece is thoughtfully designed so each shape and silhouette will vary slightly in how it fits.

Use our size guide as well as the size and fit section of your desired hat to find your perfect fit.

settings.heading: How to find your hat size
settings.content:
We have a few simple tips to help you find the perfect sized hat for you. To measure your head accurately, you will need a cloth measuring tape. We also recommend you have assistance from another person, to ensure accuracy.

settings.heading: Lack of Color Sizing
settings.content:
(MINI) 47 CM
Recommended for children and small bubs alike, this is our newest children’s mini size for those aged 1-5 years.

(KIDS) 53 CM
Our children’s size fits just right for your tiny adventurer in the making. But don’t forget – this size is only recommended for children. Each of these hats are scaled down and purposefully designed for your mini.

S / 55 CM
Our smallest size on offer. If your head measures 53 cm – 54 cm, we recommend adding a hat filler to your order, as these reduce the size of your hat by 1-2.5 cm.

M / 57 CM
Ideal for the average sized head. We recommend this medium size as a ‘standard’ or ‘average’ fit.

L / 59 CM
If you have a large head – we recommend our standard size large. It’s a no brainer.

XL / 61 CM
Available in most styles and sold exclusively online, our extra-large size is here to save the day.

XXL / 63 CM
As the largest size we currently offer, our XXL is only available in selected styles and is sold exclusively online.

settings.heading: How to find your fit
settings.content:
How would you like to wear your hat? Select from the options below. Then, follow the instructions of your preferred option to measure your head.

Be sure to follow the instructions of your preferred option, there are significant differences between them.
